Job Title: Phlebotomist - Patient Service Centers Virtual Hiring Event
Job Description:
$1k SIGN ON BONUS
We have many Patient Service Centers (PSCs) located throughout the Phoenix metro area. These PSCs are often located in medical office suites and are outpatient settings used for sample collection for patients of all ages and for a variety of testing. Area doctors refer their patients to our locations for specimen collection. Our Patient Service Center phlebotomists must to be able to work in a high volume environment and will often draw 40 or more patients in a day. Team players and a passion to work in high productivity setting are a must in this ever-changing environment.
To learn more about out Patient Service Phlebotomy setting, check out our video: https://youtu.be/DZjDuNeje_g
CORE FUNCTIONS

Nuvance Health has a network of convenient hospital and outpatient locations — Danbury Hospital, New Milford Hospital, Norwalk Hospital and Sharon Hospital in Connecticut, and Northern Dutchess Hospital, Putnam Hospital Center and Vassar Brothers Medical Center in New York — plus multiple primary and specialty care physician practices locations, including The Heart Center, a leading provider of cardiology care, and two urgent care offices. Non-acute care is offered through various affiliates, including the Thompson House for rehabilitation and skilled nursing services, and the Home Care organizations.
Summary:
Performs phlebotomy (venipunctures), assists technical staff in preparing specimens and equipment for patient testing. Maintains proper inventory of reagents and control materials. Performs clerical functions associated with accessioning, result reporting, referred testing and customer service.
Responsibilities:
1. Identifies patient, communicates process to patient and collects specimens from patients for subsequent lab
analysis in accordance with approved techniques and observes Universal Precautions. Delivers samples to the
appropriate lab. Logs samples in the Lab LIS.
2. Ensures specimen integrity while performing specimen accessioning and processing using established handling,
labeling and processing procedures. Where applicable, maintains daily operation of the front end automation
system (MPA); i.e. loading caps aliquot tubes and other system function checks as determined. Loads
samples received on the MPA.
3. Prepares specimens for dispatch to reference laboratory or intralaboratory, monitors send-out pending test
list/specimen manifest and enters send-out results into the laboratory information system. Processes, stains
and cover slips slide where applicable.
4. Prepares control material, performs preventive maintenance (i.e. thermometer calibration etc.), completes
maintenance logs and performs instrument quality control, oversees refrigerator and freezer temperature
recording, etc.
5. Performs phlebotomy according to established policy and procedure using a PDA whenever applicable.
6. Maintains reagent inventory, labels and stores reagents appropriately, dating when received, opened and
when expires and stores appropriately.
7. Files specimens, slides and reports for easy retrieval and discards specimen at proper intervals.
8. Answers phones and insures customer satisfaction. Adds on test requests following establish loaboratory
protocol for Add-On Requests.
9. Restocks supplies in work area as needed.
10. Communicates well with other staff members to ensure excellent customer service and appropriate follow-up.
11. Fulfills all compliance responsibilities related to the position.
12. Performs other duties as assigned.

Requires a minimum formal education of High School Diploma and minimum of one year job-related experience.
Strong phlebotomy skills. Organizational and customer service skills. Data entry.
Phlebotomy Certification preferred, not required.

Marken is a wholly owned subsidiary of UPS and is a critical part of UPS Healthcare. Job Description
Phlebotomist - Norwich, CT - Monday-Friday 8:30am - 5:30pm (Rotational Saturday)
Job Summary
The Patient Services Representative I (PSR I) is the face of Quest Diagnostics to our clients and patients. The PSR I greets patients in a warm and friendly manner, registers patients in computer, verifies client order and patient demographics, obtains billing information, collects payment and collects quality samples from patients; then prepares those specimens for lab testing while following established practices and procedures. The PSR I works independently as well as part of a team to maintain daily service center quality standards, including supply ordering, temperature monitoring, and maintaining records as required by local/federal regulations.

A successful candidate will demonstrate, agility, customer focus, integrity, sense of urgency, reliability, attention to detail and compassion, while focusing on process excellence skills and sensitivity to confidentiality. Successful applicants may be assigned to work in a doctor's office, a patient service center, skilled nursing facility. a house call environment, or where business needs dictate.

Job Accountabilities (Responsibilities)
1.Collect specimens according to established procedures. This includes, but not limited to: drug screens, biometric screening and insurance exams.
2.Administer oral solutions according to established training.
3.Research test/client information and confirm and verify all written and electronic orders by utilizing lab technology systems, Client contact, and approved tools.
4. Ability to navigate a computer and accurately enter data is a requirement to be successful in this role.
5.Obtain identification and accurately enter billing information and collect payments when required, following corporate policies.
6.Processing specimens including: labeling, centrifuging, aliquoting, freezing and preparing for transport as required by test order.
7. Perform all non-patient facing duties, including inventory, stock supplies, sanitizing, filing, answering phones and utilizing email as appropriate.
8.Read, understand and comply with departmental policies, protocols and procedures.
9.Assist with compilation and submission of statistics and data when required.
10.Maintain all appropriate phlebotomy logs in a timely manner and based on frequency, such as maintenance logs and temperature logs.
11.Complete online and in person training courses timely.

[All requirements are subject to possible modifications to reasonably accommodate individuals with disabilities. All duties and requirements are essential job functions.]

Required Education
1.High school diploma or equivalent.
2.Medical training: medical assistant or paramedic training preferred.
3.Phlebotomy certification preferred. Required in California, Nevada, and Washington.

Work Experience
1.One year phlebotomy experience preferred.
2.Customer service in a retail or service environment preferred.
3.Keyboard/data entry experience.

All requirements are subject to possible modifications to reasonably accommodate individuals with disabilities. Quest Diagnostics is an Equal Opportunity Employer: Women / Minorities / Veterans / Disabled / Sexual Orientation / Gender Identity / Citizenship.

Benefits/Perks:
Day 1 Medical/Dental/Vision for FT
15 PTO days first year
Annual Bonus Opportunity
401K matching
Tuition Reimbursement for undergraduate and graduate programs for FT employees who work 30+ hours
Opportunities for career advancement
Training provided!

Job Title: Phlebotomist - In Office Phlebotomy Virtual Hiring Event
Job Description:
$1k SIGN ON BONUS
As our In Office Phlebotomist, you will work at a doctor’s office (family practices, OB’s, Endocrinology offices, HIV clinics, Oncology practices, Gastroenterology, etc.) and will be responsible not only for quality specimen collection and processing, but also for patient focused care and client customer service.
To learn more about our In Office Phlebotomy career settings, check out our video: https://youtu.be/ixLBWag-d10


CORE FUNCTIONS
1. To include the following: 1) specimen collection 2) Manage client relationship within Compliance regulations to ensure that their needs are met and Sonora Quest’s business objectives are satisfied 3) general laboratory specimen processing or 4) referral laboratory processing. In doing so, ensuring correct patient and specimen identification and specimen integrity by using appropriate techniques for all age criteria as required. Only staff with a high school diploma or GED may perform any specified analytical testing, i.e. Point of Care testing.
2. Enters and verifies patient demographics, location, physician data, tests requested, time and date of collection, appropriate clinical information, and all other pertinent data found on requisitions as required for processing and billing. Verifies accuracy of entered information. Verifies appropriateness of specimens received. Aliquots and labels specimens according to established departmental procedures and practices, delivers specimens to the technical area in a timely manner and / or performs initial processing and preparation of samples for transport. Level II will assist lead in monitoring workflow and training of new employees
3. Focuses on quality by assuring that all work performed is accurate and complete. Completes documents legibly and accurately per site protocol. Follows established methods and practices. Maintains familiarity with departmental procedures. Uses appropriate documentation to record communications. Communicate courteously and professionally and responds accordingly. Initiates computer generated reports as required for patient reporting and quality assurance monitoring. Meets departmental standards for productivity and quality as currently defined. Level II will have knowledge of more computer functions, i.e. A.R.E. Actively participates in input to dept/system via committees or Six Sigma teams. Maintains acceptable specimen rejection rates and meets the departmental standards for productivity and quality as currently defined.
4. Participates in departmental financial responsibilities through the appropriate use of supplies and materials. Avoids excessive waste. Participates in department initiatives to reduce costs and improve service. Basic knowledge of billing. Commitment to error free work environment.
5. Communicates courteously and professionally with internal and external customers. Interacts with co-workers with an emphasis on teamwork and a focus on customer service. All employees must be able to work all areas/departments/shifts as assigned. Resolves basic service issues. Attends meetings and remains current with internal/external communications, i.e. e-mail, newsletters, etc. Increased knowledge of laboratory terminology.
6. Acknowledges and understands the importance of ‘Patient Rights’ and privacy (HIPAA). Promotes, supports and exhibits behavior consistent with the Mission, Vision, and Values of Laboratory Sciences of Arizona and customer-focused care.

Job Description
Phlebotomist - Norwich, CT - Monday-Friday 8:30am - 5:30pm (Rotational Saturday)
Job Summary
The Patient Services Representative I (PSR I) is the face of Quest Diagnostics to our clients and patients. The PSR I greets patients in a warm and friendly manner, registers patients in computer, verifies client order and patient demographics, obtains billing information, collects payment and collects quality samples from patients; then prepares those specimens for lab testing while following established practices and procedures. The PSR I works independently as well as part of a team to maintain daily service center quality standards, including supply ordering, temperature monitoring, and maintaining records as required by local/federal regulations.

A successful candidate will demonstrate, agility, customer focus, integrity, sense of urgency, reliability, attention to detail and compassion, while focusing on process excellence skills and sensitivity to confidentiality. Successful applicants may be assigned to work in a doctor's office, a patient service center, skilled nursing facility. a house call environment, or where business needs dictate.

Job Accountabilities (Responsibilities)
1.Collect specimens according to established procedures. This includes, but not limited to: drug screens, biometric screening and insurance exams.
2.Administer oral solutions according to established training.
3.Research test/client information and confirm and verify all written and electronic orders by utilizing lab technology systems, Client contact, and approved tools.
4. Ability to navigate a computer and accurately enter data is a requirement to be successful in this role.
5.Obtain identification and accurately enter billing information and collect payments when required, following corporate policies.
6.Processing specimens including: labeling, centrifuging, aliquoting, freezing and preparing for transport as required by test order.
7. Perform all non-patient facing duties, including inventory, stock supplies, sanitizing, filing, answering phones and utilizing email as appropriate.
8.Read, understand and comply with departmental policies, protocols and procedures.
9.Assist with compilation and submission of statistics and data when required.
10.Maintain all appropriate phlebotomy logs in a timely manner and based on frequency, such as maintenance logs and temperature logs.
11.Complete online and in person training courses timely.

[All requirements are subject to possible modifications to reasonably accommodate individuals with disabilities. All duties and requirements are essential job functions.]

Required Education
1.High school diploma or equivalent.
2.Medical training: medical assistant or paramedic training preferred.
3.Phlebotomy certification preferred. Required in California, Nevada, and Washington.

Work Experience
1.One year phlebotomy experience preferred.
2.Customer service in a retail or service environment preferred.
3.Keyboard/data entry experience.

All requirements are subject to possible modifications to reasonably accommodate individuals with disabilities. Quest Diagnostics is an Equal Opportunity Employer: Women / Minorities / Veterans / Disabled / Sexual Orientation / Gender Identity / Citizenship.

Benefits/Perks:
Day 1 Medical/Dental/Vision for FT
15 PTO days first year
Annual Bonus Opportunity
401K matching
Tuition Reimbursement for undergraduate and graduate programs for FT employees who work 30+ hours
Opportunities for career advancement
Training provided!

Job Title: Phlebotomist (Day and Eve and Eve and Night Rotating Shifts)
Job Description:
Nuvance Health has a network of convenient hospital and outpatient locations — Danbury Hospital, New Milford Hospital, Norwalk Hospital and Sharon Hospital in Connecticut, and Northern Dutchess Hospital, Putnam Hospital Center and Vassar Brothers Medical Center in New York — plus multiple primary and specialty care physician practices locations, including The Heart Center, a leading provider of cardiology care, and two urgent care offices. Non-acute care is offered through various affiliates, including the Thompson House for rehabilitation and skilled nursing services, and the Home Care organizations.
Summary:
This position performs phlebotomy (venipunctures), works/travels at off-site locations i.e. satellites, registration (patient demographics, insurance coverage, obtains necessary signatures and waivers of non-coverage), order entry, specimen labeling, aliquoting, creates specimen transfer lists, and customer service functions.
Responsibilities:
1. Greets customers promptly in a friendly manner, assists patients with special needs, and provides necessary information, always respectful of confidentiality.
2. Acts as Laboratory customer service representative while providing service to inpatients and outpatients.
3. Accurately identifies patient, performs accurate and complete registration and order entry, and obtains necessary consents and signatures, when applicable.
4. Obtains all required information for billing, enters diagnosis code(s) as required. Enters information and follows registration protocols as needed to insure accurate and timely billing of services.
5. Communicates process to patient and collects specimens from patient for subsequent analysis, in accordance with approved techniques and observing Universal Precautions. Delivers samples to the laboratory, logs specimens into Lab using LIS.
6. Communicates well with other staff members to ensure excellent customer service and appropriate follow-up.
7. Alerts appropriate personnel and follows established protocols in operational situations to prevent crisis & service delays.
8. Promotes and maintains working relationships within a multi-skilled team environment to facilitate team visions & goals/teamwork.
9. Participates in education opportunities, staff meetings & in-service as scheduled. Reviews minutes of meetings not attended.
10. Restocks supplies in work area as needed.
11. Employee is responsible for following the policies and procedures related to WCHN compliance protocols.
12. Fulfills all compliance responsibilities related to the position.
13. Maintain and Model Nuvance Health Foundational Values (Personal, Imaginative, Agile, Connected).
14. Performs other duties as required.

High School Diploma.
Data entry required. Phlebotomy experience. Customer service skills. CT Driver's license required. Travel to off-site locations.

Summary:
Performs phlebotomy (venipunctures), assists technical staff in preparing specimens and equipment for patient testing. Maintains proper inventory of reagents and control materials. Performs clerical functions associated with accessioning, result reporting, referred testing and customer service.
Responsibilities:
1. Identifies patient, communicates process to patient and collects specimens from patients for subsequent lab
analysis in accordance with approved techniques and observes Universal Precautions. Delivers samples to the
appropriate lab. Logs samples in the Lab LIS.
2. Ensures specimen integrity while performing specimen accessioning and processing using established handling,
labeling and processing procedures. Where applicable, maintains daily operation of the front end automation
system (MPA); i.e. loading caps aliquot tubes and other system function checks as determined. Loads
samples received on the MPA.
3. Prepares specimens for dispatch to reference laboratory or intralaboratory, monitors send-out pending test
list/specimen manifest and enters send-out results into the laboratory information system. Processes, stains
and cover slips slide where applicable.
4. Prepares control material, performs preventive maintenance (i.e. thermometer calibration etc.), completes
maintenance logs and performs instrument quality control, oversees refrigerator and freezer temperature
recording, etc.
5. Performs phlebotomy according to established policy and procedure using a PDA whenever applicable.
6. Maintains reagent inventory, labels and stores reagents appropriately, dating when received, opened and
when expires and stores appropriately.
7. Files specimens, slides and reports for easy retrieval and discards specimen at proper intervals.
8. Answers phones and insures customer satisfaction. Adds on test requests following establish loaboratory
protocol for Add-On Requests.
9. Restocks supplies in work area as needed.
10. Communicates well with other staff members to ensure excellent customer service and appropriate follow-up.

Job Description
Phlebotomist - Norwich, CT - Monday-Friday 8:30am - 5:30pm (Rotational Saturday)
Job Summary
The Patient Services Representative I (PSR I) is the face of Quest Diagnostics to our clients and patients. The PSR I greets patients in a warm and friendly manner, registers patients in computer, verifies client order and patient demographics, obtains billing information, collects payment and collects quality samples from patients; then prepares those specimens for lab testing while following established practices and procedures. The PSR I works independently as well as part of a team to maintain daily service center quality standards, including supply ordering, temperature monitoring, and maintaining records as required by local/federal regulations.

A successful candidate will demonstrate, agility, customer focus, integrity, sense of urgency, reliability, attention to detail and compassion, while focusing on process excellence skills and sensitivity to confidentiality. Successful applicants may be assigned to work in a doctor's office, a patient service center, skilled nursing facility. a house call environment, or where business needs dictate.

Job Accountabilities (Responsibilities)
1.Collect specimens according to established procedures. This includes, but not limited to: drug screens, biometric screening and insurance exams.
2.Administer oral solutions according to established training.
3.Research test/client information and confirm and verify all written and electronic orders by utilizing lab technology systems, Client contact, and approved tools.
4. Ability to navigate a computer and accurately enter data is a requirement to be successful in this role.
5.Obtain identification and accurately enter billing information and collect payments when required, following corporate policies.
6.Processing specimens including: labeling, centrifuging, aliquoting, freezing and preparing for transport as required by test order.
7. Perform all non-patient facing duties, including inventory, stock supplies, sanitizing, filing, answering phones and utilizing email as appropriate.
8.Read, understand and comply with departmental policies, protocols and procedures.
9.Assist with compilation and submission of statistics and data when required.
10.Maintain all appropriate phlebotomy logs in a timely manner and based on frequency, such as maintenance logs and temperature logs.
11.Complete online and in person training courses timely.

[All requirements are subject to possible modifications to reasonably accommodate individuals with disabilities. All duties and requirements are essential job functions.]

Required Education
1.High school diploma or equivalent.
2.Medical training: medical assistant or paramedic training preferred.
3.Phlebotomy certification preferred. Required in California, Nevada, and Washington.

Work Experience
1.One year phlebotomy experience preferred.
2.Customer service in a retail or service environment preferred.
3.Keyboard/data entry experience.

All requirements are subject to possible modifications to reasonably accommodate individuals with disabilities. Quest Diagnostics is an Equal Opportunity Employer: Women / Minorities / Veterans / Disabled / Sexual Orientation / Gender Identity / Citizenship.

Job Title: Phlebotomist - Mobile Diagnostics Virtual Hiring Event
Job Description:
$1k SIGN ON BONUS
Our Mobile Diagnostics team provides quality Phlebotomy care throughout the Phoenix Metro area covering anywhere from nursing homes, PRN's, clinics, assisted living, individual home draws and call backs/stats. Our Mobile Diagnostics Phlebotomists play a critical role in helping physicians provide accurate diagnosis and medical treatment in our community. Our Mobile Diagnostics Phlebotomists typically work early hours and drive to different contracted long term care facilities. Company car is provided!
CORE FUNCTIONS
1. To include the following: 1) specimen collection 2) general laboratory specimen processing or 3) referral laboratory processing. In doing so, ensuring correct patient and specimen identification and specimen integrity by using appropriate techniques for all age criteria as required. Only staff with a high school diploma or GED may perform any specified analytical testing, i.e. Point of Care testing.

Nuvance Health has a network of convenient hospital and outpatient locations — Danbury Hospital, New Milford Hospital, Norwalk Hospital and Sharon Hospital in Connecticut, and Northern Dutchess Hospital, Putnam Hospital Center and Vassar Brothers Medical Center in New York — plus multiple primary and specialty care physician practices locations, including The Heart Center, a leading provider of cardiology care, and two urgent care offices. Non-acute care is offered through various affiliates, including the Thompson House for rehabilitation and skilled nursing services, and the Home Care organizations.
Summary:
Performs phlebotomy (venipunctures), assists technical staff in preparing specimens and equipment for patient testing. Maintains proper inventory of reagents and control materials. Performs clerical functions associated with accessioning, result reporting, referred testing and customer service.
Responsibilities:
1. Identifies patient, communicates process to patient and collects specimens from patients for subsequent lab
analysis in accordance with approved techniques and observes Universal Precautions. Delivers samples to the
appropriate lab. Logs samples in the Lab LIS.
2. Ensures specimen integrity while performing specimen accessioning and processing using established handling,
labeling and processing procedures. Where applicable, maintains daily operation of the front end automation
system (MPA); i.e. loading caps aliquot tubes and other system function checks as determined. Loads
samples received on the MPA.
3. Prepares specimens for dispatch to reference laboratory or intralaboratory, monitors send-out pending test
list/specimen manifest and enters send-out results into the laboratory information system. Processes, stains
and cover slips slide where applicable.
4. Prepares control material, performs preventive maintenance (i.e. thermometer calibration etc.), completes
maintenance logs and performs instrument quality control, oversees refrigerator and freezer temperature
recording, etc.
5. Performs phlebotomy according to established policy and procedure using a PDA whenever applicable.
6. Maintains reagent inventory, labels and stores reagents appropriately, dating when received, opened and
when expires and stores appropriately.
7. Files specimens, slides and reports for easy retrieval and discards specimen at proper intervals.
8. Answers phones and insures customer satisfaction. Adds on test requests following establish loaboratory
protocol for Add-On Requests.
9. Restocks supplies in work area as needed.
10. Communicates well with other staff members to ensure excellent customer service and appropriate follow-up.
11. Fulfills all compliance responsibilities related to the position.
12. Performs other duties as assigned.

Job Description
Phlebotomist - Norwich, CT - Monday-Friday 8:30am - 5:30pm (Rotational Saturday)
Job Summary
The Patient Services Representative I (PSR I) is the face of Quest Diagnostics to our clients and patients. The PSR I greets patients in a warm and friendly manner, registers patients in computer, verifies client order and patient demographics, obtains billing information, collects payment and collects quality samples from patients; then prepares those specimens for lab testing while following established practices and procedures. The PSR I works independently as well as part of a team to maintain daily service center quality standards, including supply ordering, temperature monitoring, and maintaining records as required by local/federal regulations.

A successful candidate will demonstrate, agility, customer focus, integrity, sense of urgency, reliability, attention to detail and compassion, while focusing on process excellence skills and sensitivity to confidentiality. Successful applicants may be assigned to work in a doctor's office, a patient service center, skilled nursing facility. a house call environment, or where business needs dictate.

Job Accountabilities (Responsibilities)
1.Collect specimens according to established procedures. This includes, but not limited to: drug screens, biometric screening and insurance exams.
2.Administer oral solutions according to established training.
3.Research test/client information and confirm and verify all written and electronic orders by utilizing lab technology systems, Client contact, and approved tools.
4. Ability to navigate a computer and accurately enter data is a requirement to be successful in this role.
5.Obtain identification and accurately enter billing information and collect payments when required, following corporate policies.
6.Processing specimens including: labeling, centrifuging, aliquoting, freezing and preparing for transport as required by test order.
7. Perform all non-patient facing duties, including inventory, stock supplies, sanitizing, filing, answering phones and utilizing email as appropriate.
8.Read, understand and comply with departmental policies, protocols and procedures.
9.Assist with compilation and submission of statistics and data when required.
10.Maintain all appropriate phlebotomy logs in a timely manner and based on frequency, such as maintenance logs and temperature logs.
11.Complete online and in person training courses timely.

[All requirements are subject to possible modifications to reasonably accommodate individuals with disabilities. All duties and requirements are essential job functions.]

Required Education
1.High school diploma or equivalent.
2.Medical training: medical assistant or paramedic training preferred.
3.Phlebotomy certification preferred. Required in California, Nevada, and Washington.

Work Experience
1.One year phlebotomy experience preferred.
2.Customer service in a retail or service environment preferred.
3.Keyboard/data entry experience.

All requirements are subject to possible modifications to reasonably accommodate individuals with disabilities. Quest Diagnostics is an Equal Opportunity Employer: Women / Minorities / Veterans / Disabled / Sexual Orientation / Gender Identity / Citizenship.

Nuvance Health has a network of convenient hospital and outpatient locations — Danbury Hospital, New Milford Hospital, Norwalk Hospital and Sharon Hospital in Connecticut, and Northern Dutchess Hospital, Putnam Hospital Center and Vassar Brothers Medical Center in New York — plus multiple primary and specialty care physician practices locations, including The Heart Center, a leading provider of cardiology care, and two urgent care offices. Summary:
This position performs phlebotomy (venipunctures), works/travels at off-site locations i.e. satellites, registration (patient demographics, insurance coverage, obtains necessary signatures and waivers of non-coverage), order entry, specimen labeling, aliquoting, creates specimen transfer lists, and customer service functions.

1. Greets customers promptly in a friendly manner, assists patients with special needs, and provides necessary information, always respectful of confidentiality.
2. Acts as Laboratory customer service representative while providing service to inpatients and outpatients.
3. Accurately identifies patient, performs accurate and complete registration and order entry, and obtains necessary consents and signatures, when applicable.
4. Obtains all required information for billing, enters diagnosis code(s) as required. Enters information and follows registration protocols as needed to insure accurate and timely billing of services.
5. Communicates process to patient and collects specimens from patient for subsequent analysis, in accordance with approved techniques and observing Universal Precautions. Delivers samples to the laboratory, logs specimens into Lab using LIS.
6. Communicates well with other staff members to ensure excellent customer service and appropriate follow-up.
7. Alerts appropriate personnel and follows established protocols in operational situations to prevent crisis & service delays.
8. Promotes and maintains working relationships within a multi-skilled team environment to facilitate team visions & goals/teamwork.
9. Participates in education opportunities, staff meetings & in-service as scheduled. Reviews minutes of meetings not attended.
10. Restocks supplies in work area as needed.
11. Employee is responsible for following the policies and procedures related to WCHN compliance protocols.
12. Fulfills all compliance responsibilities related to the position.
13. Maintain and Model Nuvance Health Foundational Values (Personal, Imaginative, Agile, Connected).
14. Performs other duties as required.

High School Diploma.
Data entry required. Phlebotomy experience. Customer service skills. CT Driver's license required. Travel to off-site locations.

About Marken
Marken is a wholly owned subsidiary of UPS and is a critical part of UPS Healthcare. With Polar Speed and Marken included, the UPS Healthcare division staffs 128 locations with 5,500 employees worldwide. Marken offers a state-of-the-art GMP-compliant depot network and logistic hubs for clinical drug product storage and distribution in 56 locations worldwide, while maintaining the leading position for Direct-to-Patient and Home Healthcare services, biological sample shipments and biological kit production. Marken’s dedicated 1,650+ staff members manage 100,000 drug product and biological sample shipments every month at all temperature ranges in more than 220 countries. Additional services such as ancillary material sourcing, storage and distribution, shipment lane verification and qualifications, as well as GDP, regulatory and compliance consultancy add to Marken’s unique position in the pharma and logistics industry.

Nuvance Health has a network of convenient hospital and outpatient locations — Danbury Hospital, New Milford Hospital, Norwalk Hospital and Sharon Hospital in Connecticut, and Northern Dutchess Hospital, Putnam Hospital Center and Vassar Brothers Medical Center in New York — plus multiple primary and specialty care physician practices locations, including The Heart Center, a leading provider of cardiology care, and two urgent care offices. Non-acute care is offered through various affiliates, including the Thompson House for rehabilitation and skilled nursing services, and the Home Care organizations.
Summary:
Performs phlebotomy (venipunctures), assists technical staff in preparing specimens and equipment for patient testing. Maintains proper inventory of reagents and control materials. Performs clerical functions associated with accessioning, result reporting, referred testing and customer service.
Responsibilities:
1. Identifies patient, communicates process to patient and collects specimens from patients for subsequent lab
analysis in accordance with approved techniques and observes Universal Precautions. Delivers samples to the
appropriate lab. Logs samples in the Lab LIS.
2. Ensures specimen integrity while performing specimen accessioning and processing using established handling,
labeling and processing procedures. Where applicable, maintains daily operation of the front end automation
system (MPA); i.e. loading caps aliquot tubes and other system function checks as determined. Loads
samples received on the MPA.
3. Prepares specimens for dispatch to reference laboratory or intralaboratory, monitors send-out pending test
list/specimen manifest and enters send-out results into the laboratory information system. Processes, stains
and cover slips slide where applicable.
4. Prepares control material, performs preventive maintenance (i.e. thermometer calibration etc.), completes
maintenance logs and performs instrument quality control, oversees refrigerator and freezer temperature
recording, etc.
5. Performs phlebotomy according to established policy and procedure using a PDA whenever applicable.
6. Maintains reagent inventory, labels and stores reagents appropriately, dating when received, opened and
when expires and stores appropriately.
7. Files specimens, slides and reports for easy retrieval and discards specimen at proper intervals.
8. Answers phones and insures customer satisfaction. Adds on test requests following establish loaboratory
protocol for Add-On Requests.
9. Restocks supplies in work area as needed.
10. Communicates well with other staff members to ensure excellent customer service and appropriate follow-up.
11. Fulfills all compliance responsibilities related to the position.
12. Performs other duties as assigned.

Requires a minimum formal education of High School Diploma and minimum of one year job-related experience.
Strong phlebotomy skills. Organizational and customer service skills. Data entry.
Phlebotomy Certification preferred, not required.

Job Title: Phlebotomist (Day and Eve and Eve and Night Rotating Shifts)
Job Description:
Nuvance Health has a network of convenient hospital and outpatient locations — Danbury Hospital, New Milford Hospital, Norwalk Hospital and Sharon Hospital in Connecticut, and Northern Dutchess Hospital, Putnam Hospital Center and Vassar Brothers Medical Center in New York — plus multiple primary and specialty care physician practices locations, including The Heart Center, a leading provider of cardiology care, and two urgent care offices. Non-acute care is offered through various affiliates, including the Thompson House for rehabilitation and skilled nursing services, and the Home Care organizations.
Summary:
This position performs phlebotomy (venipunctures), works/travels at off-site locations i.e. satellites, registration (patient demographics, insurance coverage, obtains necessary signatures and waivers of non-coverage), order entry, specimen labeling, aliquoting, creates specimen transfer lists, and customer service functions.
Responsibilities:
1. Greets customers promptly in a friendly manner, assists patients with special needs, and provides necessary information, always respectful of confidentiality.
2. Acts as Laboratory customer service representative while providing service to inpatients and outpatients.
3. Accurately identifies patient, performs accurate and complete registration and order entry, and obtains necessary consents and signatures, when applicable.
4. Obtains all required information for billing, enters diagnosis code(s) as required. Enters information and follows registration protocols as needed to insure accurate and timely billing of services.
5. Communicates process to patient and collects specimens from patient for subsequent analysis, in accordance with approved techniques and observing Universal Precautions. Delivers samples to the laboratory, logs specimens into Lab using LIS.
6. Communicates well with other staff members to ensure excellent customer service and appropriate follow-up.
7. Alerts appropriate personnel and follows established protocols in operational situations to prevent crisis & service delays.
8. Promotes and maintains working relationships within a multi-skilled team environment to facilitate team visions & goals/teamwork.
9. Participates in education opportunities, staff meetings & in-service as scheduled. Reviews minutes of meetings not attended.
10. Restocks supplies in work area as needed.
11. Employee is responsible for following the policies and procedures related to WCHN compliance protocols.
12. Fulfills all compliance responsibilities related to the position.
13. Maintain and Model Nuvance Health Foundational Values (Personal, Imaginative, Agile, Connected).
14. Performs other duties as required.

High School Diploma.
Data entry required. Phlebotomy experience. Customer service skills. CT Driver's license required. Travel to off-site locations.

Job Title: Phlebotomist - Patient Service Centers Virtual Hiring Event
Job Description:
$1k SIGN ON BONUS
We have many Patient Service Centers (PSCs) located throughout the Phoenix metro area. These PSCs are often located in medical office suites and are outpatient settings used for sample collection for patients of all ages and for a variety of testing. Area doctors refer their patients to our locations for specimen collection. Our Patient Service Center phlebotomists must to be able to work in a high volume environment and will often draw 40 or more patients in a day. Team players and a passion to work in high productivity setting are a must in this ever-changing environment.
To learn more about out Patient Service Phlebotomy setting, check out our video: https://youtu.be/DZjDuNeje_g
CORE FUNCTIONS

Nuvance Health has a network of convenient hospital and outpatient locations — Danbury Hospital, New Milford Hospital, Norwalk Hospital and Sharon Hospital in Connecticut, and Northern Dutchess Hospital, Putnam Hospital Center and Vassar Brothers Medical Center in New York — plus multiple primary and specialty care physician practices locations, including The Heart Center, a leading provider of cardiology care, and two urgent care offices. Non-acute care is offered through various affiliates, including the Thompson House for rehabilitation and skilled nursing services, and the Home Care organizations.
Summary:
Performs phlebotomy (venipunctures), assists technical staff in preparing specimens and equipment for patient testing. Maintains proper inventory of reagents and control materials. Performs clerical functions associated with accessioning, result reporting, referred testing and customer service.
Responsibilities:
1. Identifies patient, communicates process to patient and collects specimens from patients for subsequent lab
analysis in accordance with approved techniques and observes Universal Precautions. Delivers samples to the
appropriate lab. Logs samples in the Lab LIS.
2. Ensures specimen integrity while performing specimen accessioning and processing using established handling,
labeling and processing procedures. Where applicable, maintains daily operation of the front end automation
system (MPA); i.e. loading caps aliquot tubes and other system function checks as determined. Loads
samples received on the MPA.
3. Prepares specimens for dispatch to reference laboratory or intralaboratory, monitors send-out pending test
list/specimen manifest and enters send-out results into the laboratory information system. Processes, stains
and cover slips slide where applicable.
4. Prepares control material, performs preventive maintenance (i.e. thermometer calibration etc.), completes
maintenance logs and performs instrument quality control, oversees refrigerator and freezer temperature
recording, etc.
5. Performs phlebotomy according to established policy and procedure using a PDA whenever applicable.
6. Maintains reagent inventory, labels and stores reagents appropriately, dating when received, opened and
when expires and stores appropriately.
7. Files specimens, slides and reports for easy retrieval and discards specimen at proper intervals.
8. Answers phones and insures customer satisfaction. Adds on test requests following establish loaboratory
protocol for Add-On Requests.
9. Restocks supplies in work area as needed.
10. Communicates well with other staff members to ensure excellent customer service and appropriate follow-up.
11. Fulfills all compliance responsibilities related to the position.
12. Performs other duties as assigned.

Requires a minimum formal education of High School Diploma and minimum of one year job-related experience.
Strong phlebotomy skills. Organizational and customer service skills. Data entry.
Phlebotomy Certification preferred, not required.

Job Description
Phlebotomist - Norwich, CT - Monday-Friday 8:30am - 5:30pm (Rotational Saturday)
Job Summary
The Patient Services Representative I (PSR I) is the face of Quest Diagnostics to our clients and patients. The PSR I greets patients in a warm and friendly manner, registers patients in computer, verifies client order and patient demographics, obtains billing information, collects payment and collects quality samples from patients; then prepares those specimens for lab testing while following established practices and procedures. The PSR I works independently as well as part of a team to maintain daily service center quality standards, including supply ordering, temperature monitoring, and maintaining records as required by local/federal regulations.

A successful candidate will demonstrate, agility, customer focus, integrity, sense of urgency, reliability, attention to detail and compassion, while focusing on process excellence skills and sensitivity to confidentiality. Successful applicants may be assigned to work in a doctor's office, a patient service center, skilled nursing facility. a house call environment, or where business needs dictate.

Job Accountabilities (Responsibilities)
1.Collect specimens according to established procedures. This includes, but not limited to: drug screens, biometric screening and insurance exams.
2.Administer oral solutions according to established training.
3.Research test/client information and confirm and verify all written and electronic orders by utilizing lab technology systems, Client contact, and approved tools.
4. Ability to navigate a computer and accurately enter data is a requirement to be successful in this role.
5.Obtain identification and accurately enter billing information and collect payments when required, following corporate policies.
6.Processing specimens including: labeling, centrifuging, aliquoting, freezing and preparing for transport as required by test order.
7. Perform all non-patient facing duties, including inventory, stock supplies, sanitizing, filing, answering phones and utilizing email as appropriate.
8.Read, understand and comply with departmental policies, protocols and procedures.
9.Assist with compilation and submission of statistics and data when required.
10.Maintain all appropriate phlebotomy logs in a timely manner and based on frequency, such as maintenance logs and temperature logs.
11.Complete online and in person training courses timely.

[All requirements are subject to possible modifications to reasonably accommodate individuals with disabilities. All duties and requirements are essential job functions.]

Required Education
1.High school diploma or equivalent.
2.Medical training: medical assistant or paramedic training preferred.
3.Phlebotomy certification preferred. Required in California, Nevada, and Washington.

Work Experience
1.One year phlebotomy experience preferred.
2.Customer service in a retail or service environment preferred.
3.Keyboard/data entry experience.

All requirements are subject to possible modifications to reasonably accommodate individuals with disabilities. Quest Diagnostics is an Equal Opportunity Employer: Women / Minorities / Veterans / Disabled / Sexual Orientation / Gender Identity / Citizenship.

Benefits/Perks:
Day 1 Medical/Dental/Vision for FT
15 PTO days first year
Annual Bonus Opportunity
401K matching
Tuition Reimbursement for undergraduate and graduate programs for FT employees who work 30+ hours
Opportunities for career advancement
Training provided!

14. Performs other duties as required.

Job Title: Phlebotomist - Patient Service Centers Virtual Hiring Event
Job Description:
$1k SIGN ON BONUS
We have many Patient Service Centers (PSCs) located throughout the Phoenix metro area. These PSCs are often located in medical office suites and are outpatient settings used for sample collection for patients of all ages and for a variety of testing. Area doctors refer their patients to our locations for specimen collection. Our Patient Service Center phlebotomists must to be able to work in a high volume environment and will often draw 40 or more patients in a day. Team players and a passion to work in high productivity setting are a must in this ever-changing environment.
To learn more about out Patient Service Phlebotomy setting, check out our video: https://youtu.be/DZjDuNeje_g
CORE FUNCTIONS

Nuvance Health has a network of convenient hospital and outpatient locations — Danbury Hospital, New Milford Hospital, Norwalk Hospital and Sharon Hospital in Connecticut, and Northern Dutchess Hospital, Putnam Hospital Center and Vassar Brothers Medical Center in New York — plus multiple primary and specialty care physician practices locations, including The Heart Center, a leading provider of cardiology care, and two urgent care offices. Non-acute care is offered through various affiliates, including the Thompson House for rehabilitation and skilled nursing services, and the Home Care organizations.
Summary:
Performs phlebotomy (venipunctures), assists technical staff in preparing specimens and equipment for patient testing. Maintains proper inventory of reagents and control materials. Performs clerical functions associated with accessioning, result reporting, referred testing and customer service.
Responsibilities:
1. Identifies patient, communicates process to patient and collects specimens from patients for subsequent lab
analysis in accordance with approved techniques and observes Universal Precautions. Delivers samples to the
appropriate lab. Logs samples in the Lab LIS.
2. Ensures specimen integrity while performing specimen accessioning and processing using established handling,
labeling and processing procedures. Where applicable, maintains daily operation of the front end automation
system (MPA); i.e. loading caps aliquot tubes and other system function checks as determined. Loads
samples received on the MPA.
3. Prepares specimens for dispatch to reference laboratory or intralaboratory, monitors send-out pending test
list/specimen manifest and enters send-out results into the laboratory information system. Processes, stains
and cover slips slide where applicable.
4. Prepares control material, performs preventive maintenance (i.e. thermometer calibration etc.), completes
maintenance logs and performs instrument quality control, oversees refrigerator and freezer temperature
recording, etc.
5. Performs phlebotomy according to established policy and procedure using a PDA whenever applicable.
6. Maintains reagent inventory, labels and stores reagents appropriately, dating when received, opened and
when expires and stores appropriately.
7. Files specimens, slides and reports for easy retrieval and discards specimen at proper intervals.
8. Answers phones and insures customer satisfaction. Adds on test requests following establish loaboratory
protocol for Add-On Requests.
9. Restocks supplies in work area as needed.
10. Communicates well with other staff members to ensure excellent customer service and appropriate follow-up.
11. Fulfills all compliance responsibilities related to the position.
12. Performs other duties as assigned.

Requires a minimum formal education of High School Diploma and minimum of one year job-related experience.
Strong phlebotomy skills. Organizational and customer service skills. Data entry.
Phlebotomy Certification preferred, not required.

Some of the many benefits included in this package are full medical, dental and vision coverage; retirement plans; paid time off; employer-paid life and disability insurance with additional buy-up coverage options; tuition and continuing education reimbursement; and a full suite of voluntary benefits such as identity theft protection and pet insurance. We foster a true human connection and give people the freedom to live extraordinary lives. A career at UCHealth is more than a job, it's a passion.

Going beyond quality requires the perfect balance of talent, integrity, drive and intellectual curiosity. Job Title: Phlebotomist - In Office Phlebotomy Virtual Hiring Event
Job Description:
$1k SIGN ON BONUS
As our In Office Phlebotomist, you will work at a doctor’s office (family practices, OB’s, Endocrinology offices, HIV clinics, Oncology practices, Gastroenterology, etc.) and will be responsible not only for quality specimen collection and processing, but also for patient focused care and client customer service.
To learn more about our In Office Phlebotomy career settings, check out our video: https://youtu.be/ixLBWag-d10


CORE FUNCTIONS
1. To include the following: 1) specimen collection 2) Manage client relationship within Compliance regulations to ensure that their needs are met and Sonora Quest’s business objectives are satisfied 3) general laboratory specimen processing or 4) referral laboratory processing. In doing so, ensuring correct patient and specimen identification and specimen integrity by using appropriate techniques for all age criteria as required. Only staff with a high school diploma or GED may perform any specified analytical testing, i.e. Point of Care testing.
2. Enters and verifies patient demographics, location, physician data, tests requested, time and date of collection, appropriate clinical information, and all other pertinent data found on requisitions as required for processing and billing. Verifies accuracy of entered information. Verifies appropriateness of specimens received. Aliquots and labels specimens according to established departmental procedures and practices, delivers specimens to the technical area in a timely manner and / or performs initial processing and preparation of samples for transport. Level II will assist lead in monitoring workflow and training of new employees
3. Focuses on quality by assuring that all work performed is accurate and complete. Completes documents legibly and accurately per site protocol. Follows established methods and practices. Maintains familiarity with departmental procedures. Uses appropriate documentation to record communications. Communicate courteously and professionally and responds accordingly. Initiates computer generated reports as required for patient reporting and quality assurance monitoring. Meets departmental standards for productivity and quality as currently defined. Level II will have knowledge of more computer functions, i.e. A.R.E. Actively participates in input to dept/system via committees or Six Sigma teams. Maintains acceptable specimen rejection rates and meets the departmental standards for productivity and quality as currently defined.
4. Participates in departmental financial responsibilities through the appropriate use of supplies and materials. Avoids excessive waste. Participates in department initiatives to reduce costs and improve service. Basic knowledge of billing. Commitment to error free work environment.
5. Communicates courteously and professionally with internal and external customers. Interacts with co-workers with an emphasis on teamwork and a focus on customer service. All employees must be able to work all areas/departments/shifts as assigned. Resolves basic service issues. Attends meetings and remains current with internal/external communications, i.e. e-mail, newsletters, etc. Increased knowledge of laboratory terminology.
6. Acknowledges and understands the importance of ‘Patient Rights’ and privacy (HIPAA). Promotes, supports and exhibits behavior consistent with the Mission, Vision, and Values of Laboratory Sciences of Arizona and customer-focused care.

labeling and processing procedures. Where applicable, maintains daily operation of the front end automation
system (MPA); i.e. loading caps aliquot tubes and other system function checks as determined. Loads
samples received on the MPA.

list/specimen manifest and enters send-out results into the laboratory information system. Processes, stains
and cover slips slide where applicable.

recording, etc.

when expires and stores appropriately.

8. Answers phones and insures customer satisfaction. Adds on test requests following establish loaboratory
protocol for Add-On Requests.
9. Restocks supplies in work area as needed.
10. Communicates well with other staff members to ensure excellent customer service and appropriate follow-up.
11. Fulfills all compliance responsibilities related to the position.
12. Performs other duties as assigned.

About Marken
Marken is a wholly owned subsidiary of UPS and is a critical part of UPS Healthcare. With Polar Speed and Marken included, the UPS Healthcare division staffs 128 locations with 5,500 employees worldwide. Marken offers a state-of-the-art GMP-compliant depot network and logistic hubs for clinical drug product storage and distribution in 56 locations worldwide, while maintaining the leading position for Direct-to-Patient and Home Healthcare services, biological sample shipments and biological kit production. Marken’s dedicated 1,650+ staff members manage 100,000 drug product and biological sample shipments every month at all temperature ranges in more than 220 countries. Additional services such as ancillary material sourcing, storage and distribution, shipment lane verification and qualifications, as well as GDP, regulatory and compliance consultancy add to Marken’s unique position in the pharma and logistics industry.

Job Description
Phlebotomist - Norwich, CT - Monday-Friday 8:30am - 5:30pm (Rotational Saturday)
Job Summary
The Patient Services Representative I (PSR I) is the face of Quest Diagnostics to our clients and patients. The PSR I greets patients in a warm and friendly manner, registers patients in computer, verifies client order and patient demographics, obtains billing information, collects payment and collects quality samples from patients; then prepares those specimens for lab testing while following established practices and procedures. The PSR I works independently as well as part of a team to maintain daily service center quality standards, including supply ordering, temperature monitoring, and maintaining records as required by local/federal regulations.

A successful candidate will demonstrate, agility, customer focus, integrity, sense of urgency, reliability, attention to detail and compassion, while focusing on process excellence skills and sensitivity to confidentiality. Successful applicants may be assigned to work in a doctor's office, a patient service center, skilled nursing facility. a house call environment, or where business needs dictate.

Job Accountabilities (Responsibilities)
1.Collect specimens according to established procedures. This includes, but not limited to: drug screens, biometric screening and insurance exams.
2.Administer oral solutions according to established training.
3.Research test/client information and confirm and verify all written and electronic orders by utilizing lab technology systems, Client contact, and approved tools.
4. Ability to navigate a computer and accurately enter data is a requirement to be successful in this role.
5.Obtain identification and accurately enter billing information and collect payments when required, following corporate policies.
6.Processing specimens including: labeling, centrifuging, aliquoting, freezing and preparing for transport as required by test order.
7. Perform all non-patient facing duties, including inventory, stock supplies, sanitizing, filing, answering phones and utilizing email as appropriate.
8.Read, understand and comply with departmental policies, protocols and procedures.
9.Assist with compilation and submission of statistics and data when required.
10.Maintain all appropriate phlebotomy logs in a timely manner and based on frequency, such as maintenance logs and temperature logs.
11.Complete online and in person training courses timely.

[All requirements are subject to possible modifications to reasonably accommodate individuals with disabilities. All duties and requirements are essential job functions.]

Required Education
1.High school diploma or equivalent.
2.Medical training: medical assistant or paramedic training preferred.
3.Phlebotomy certification preferred. Required in California, Nevada, and Washington.

Work Experience
1.One year phlebotomy experience preferred.
2.Customer service in a retail or service environment preferred.
3.Keyboard/data entry experience.

Job Title: Phlebotomist (Day and Eve and Eve and Night Rotating Shifts)
Job Description:
Nuvance Health has a network of convenient hospital and outpatient locations — Danbury Hospital, New Milford Hospital, Norwalk Hospital and Sharon Hospital in Connecticut, and Northern Dutchess Hospital, Putnam Hospital Center and Vassar Brothers Medical Center in New York — plus multiple primary and specialty care physician practices locations, including The Heart Center, a leading provider of cardiology care, and two urgent care offices. Non-acute care is offered through various affiliates, including the Thompson House for rehabilitation and skilled nursing services, and the Home Care organizations.
Summary:
This position performs phlebotomy (venipunctures), works/travels at off-site locations i.e. satellites, registration (patient demographics, insurance coverage, obtains necessary signatures and waivers of non-coverage), order entry, specimen labeling, aliquoting, creates specimen transfer lists, and customer service functions.
Responsibilities:
1. Greets customers promptly in a friendly manner, assists patients with special needs, and provides necessary information, always respectful of confidentiality.
2. Acts as Laboratory customer service representative while providing service to inpatients and outpatients.
3. Accurately identifies patient, performs accurate and complete registration and order entry, and obtains necessary consents and signatures, when applicable.
4. Obtains all required information for billing, enters diagnosis code(s) as required. Enters information and follows registration protocols as needed to insure accurate and timely billing of services.
5. Communicates process to patient and collects specimens from patient for subsequent analysis, in accordance with approved techniques and observing Universal Precautions. Delivers samples to the laboratory, logs specimens into Lab using LIS.
6. Communicates well with other staff members to ensure excellent customer service and appropriate follow-up.
7. Alerts appropriate personnel and follows established protocols in operational situations to prevent crisis & service delays.
8. Promotes and maintains working relationships within a multi-skilled team environment to facilitate team visions & goals/teamwork.
9. Participates in education opportunities, staff meetings & in-service as scheduled. Reviews minutes of meetings not attended.
10. Restocks supplies in work area as needed.
11. Employee is responsible for following the policies and procedures related to WCHN compliance protocols.
12. Fulfills all compliance responsibilities related to the position.
13. Maintain and Model Nuvance Health Foundational Values (Personal, Imaginative, Agile, Connected).
14. Performs other duties as required.

High School Diploma.
Data entry required. Phlebotomy experience. Customer service skills. CT Driver's license required. Travel to off-site locations.

Nuvance Health has a network of convenient hospital and outpatient locations — Danbury Hospital, New Milford Hospital, Norwalk Hospital and Sharon Hospital in Connecticut, and Northern Dutchess Hospital, Putnam Hospital Center and Vassar Brothers Medical Center in New York — plus multiple primary and specialty care physician practices locations, including The Heart Center, a leading provider of cardiology care, and two urgent care offices. Summary:
Performs phlebotomy (venipunctures), assists technical staff in preparing specimens and equipment for patient testing. Maintains proper inventory of reagents and control materials. Performs clerical functions associated with accessioning, result reporting, referred testing and customer service.
Responsibilities:
1. Identifies patient, communicates process to patient and collects specimens from patients for subsequent lab
analysis in accordance with approved techniques and observes Universal Precautions. Delivers samples to the
appropriate lab. Logs samples in the Lab LIS.
2. Ensures specimen integrity while performing specimen accessioning and processing using established handling,
labeling and processing procedures. Where applicable, maintains daily operation of the front end automation
system (MPA); i.e. loading caps aliquot tubes and other system function checks as determined. Loads
samples received on the MPA.
3. Prepares specimens for dispatch to reference laboratory or intralaboratory, monitors send-out pending test
list/specimen manifest and enters send-out results into the laboratory information system. Processes, stains
and cover slips slide where applicable.
4. Prepares control material, performs preventive maintenance (i.e. thermometer calibration etc.), completes
maintenance logs and performs instrument quality control, oversees refrigerator and freezer temperature
recording, etc.
5. Performs phlebotomy according to established policy and procedure using a PDA whenever applicable.
6. Maintains reagent inventory, labels and stores reagents appropriately, dating when received, opened and
when expires and stores appropriately.
7. Files specimens, slides and reports for easy retrieval and discards specimen at proper intervals.
8. Answers phones and insures customer satisfaction. Adds on test requests following establish loaboratory
protocol for Add-On Requests.
9. Restocks supplies in work area as needed.
10. Communicates well with other staff members to ensure excellent customer service and appropriate follow-up.
11. Fulfills all compliance responsibilities related to the position.
12. Performs other duties as assigned.

Requires a minimum formal education of High School Diploma and minimum of one year job-related experience.
Strong phlebotomy skills. Organizational and customer service skills. Data entry.
Phlebotomy Certification preferred, not required.

Marken is a wholly owned subsidiary of UPS and is a critical part of UPS Healthcare. Nuvance Health has a network of convenient hospital and outpatient locations — Danbury Hospital, New Milford Hospital, Norwalk Hospital and Sharon Hospital in Connecticut, and Northern Dutchess Hospital, Putnam Hospital Center and Vassar Brothers Medical Center in New York — plus multiple primary and specialty care physician practices locations, including The Heart Center, a leading provider of cardiology care, and two urgent care offices. Summary:
This position performs phlebotomy (venipunctures), works/travels at off-site locations i.e. satellites, registration (patient demographics, insurance coverage, obtains necessary signatures and waivers of non-coverage), order entry, specimen labeling, aliquoting, creates specimen transfer lists, and customer service functions.

5. Communicates process to patient and collects specimens from patient for subsequent analysis, in accordance with approved techniques and observing Universal Precautions. Delivers samples to the laboratory, logs specimens into Lab using LIS.
6. Communicates well with other staff members to ensure excellent customer service and appropriate follow-up.
7. Alerts appropriate personnel and follows established protocols in operational situations to prevent crisis & service delays.
8. Promotes and maintains working relationships within a multi-skilled team environment to facilitate team visions & goals/teamwork.

10. Restocks supplies in work area as needed.
11. Employee is responsible for following the policies and procedures related to WCHN compliance protocols.
12. Fulfills all compliance responsibilities related to the position.
13. Maintain and Model Nuvance Health Foundational Values (Personal, Imaginative, Agile, Connected).
14. Performs other duties as required.

High School Diploma.
Data entry required. Phlebotomy experience. Customer service skills. CT Driver's license required. Travel to off-site locations.

Job Description:
Nuvance Health has a network of convenient hospital and outpatient locations — Danbury Hospital, New Milford Hospital, Norwalk Hospital and Sharon Hospital in Connecticut, and Northern Dutchess Hospital, Putnam Hospital Center and Vassar Brothers Medical Center in New York — plus multiple primary and specialty care physician practices locations, including The Heart Center, a leading provider of cardiology care, and two urgent care offices. Non-acute care is offered through various affiliates, including the Thompson House for rehabilitation and skilled nursing services, and the Home Care organizations.
Summary:
Performs phlebotomy (venipunctures), assists technical staff in preparing specimens and equipment for patient testing. Maintains proper inventory of reagents and control materials. Performs clerical functions associated with accessioning, result reporting, referred testing and customer service.
Responsibilities:
1. Identifies patient, communicates process to patient and collects specimens from patients for subsequent lab
analysis in accordance with approved techniques and observes Universal Precautions. Delivers samples to the
appropriate lab. Logs samples in the Lab LIS.
2. Ensures specimen integrity while performing specimen accessioning and processing using established handling,
labeling and processing procedures. Where applicable, maintains daily operation of the front end automation
system (MPA); i.e. loading caps aliquot tubes and other system function checks as determined. Loads
samples received on the MPA.
3. Prepares specimens for dispatch to reference laboratory or intralaboratory, monitors send-out pending test
list/specimen manifest and enters send-out results into the laboratory information system. Processes, stains
and cover slips slide where applicable.
4. Prepares control material, performs preventive maintenance (i.e. thermometer calibration etc.), completes
maintenance logs and performs instrument quality control, oversees refrigerator and freezer temperature
recording, etc.
5. Performs phlebotomy according to established policy and procedure using a PDA whenever applicable.
6. Maintains reagent inventory, labels and stores reagents appropriately, dating when received, opened and
when expires and stores appropriately.
7. Files specimens, slides and reports for easy retrieval and discards specimen at proper intervals.
8. Answers phones and insures customer satisfaction. Adds on test requests following establish loaboratory
protocol for Add-On Requests.
9. Restocks supplies in work area as needed.
10. Communicates well with other staff members to ensure excellent customer service and appropriate follow-up.
11. Fulfills all compliance responsibilities related to the position.
12. Performs other duties as assigned.

Requires a minimum formal education of High School Diploma and minimum of one year job-related experience.
Strong phlebotomy skills. Organizational and customer service skills. Data entry.
Phlebotomy Certification preferred, not required.

Job Description
Phlebotomist - Norwich, CT - Monday-Friday 8:30am - 5:30pm (Rotational Saturday)
Job Summary
The Patient Services Representative I (PSR I) is the face of Quest Diagnostics to our clients and patients. The PSR I greets patients in a warm and friendly manner, registers patients in computer, verifies client order and patient demographics, obtains billing information, collects payment and collects quality samples from patients; then prepares those specimens for lab testing while following established practices and procedures. The PSR I works independently as well as part of a team to maintain daily service center quality standards, including supply ordering, temperature monitoring, and maintaining records as required by local/federal regulations.

A successful candidate will demonstrate, agility, customer focus, integrity, sense of urgency, reliability, attention to detail and compassion, while focusing on process excellence skills and sensitivity to confidentiality. Successful applicants may be assigned to work in a doctor's office, a patient service center, skilled nursing facility. a house call environment, or where business needs dictate.

Job Accountabilities (Responsibilities)
1.Collect specimens according to established procedures. This includes, but not limited to: drug screens, biometric screening and insurance exams.
2.Administer oral solutions according to established training.
3.Research test/client information and confirm and verify all written and electronic orders by utilizing lab technology systems, Client contact, and approved tools.
4. Ability to navigate a computer and accurately enter data is a requirement to be successful in this role.
5.Obtain identification and accurately enter billing information and collect payments when required, following corporate policies.
6.Processing specimens including: labeling, centrifuging, aliquoting, freezing and preparing for transport as required by test order.
7. Perform all non-patient facing duties, including inventory, stock supplies, sanitizing, filing, answering phones and utilizing email as appropriate.
8.Read, understand and comply with departmental policies, protocols and procedures.
9.Assist with compilation and submission of statistics and data when required.
10.Maintain all appropriate phlebotomy logs in a timely manner and based on frequency, such as maintenance logs and temperature logs.
11.Complete online and in person training courses timely.

[All requirements are subject to possible modifications to reasonably accommodate individuals with disabilities. All duties and requirements are essential job functions.]

Required Education
1.High school diploma or equivalent.
2.Medical training: medical assistant or paramedic training preferred.
3.Phlebotomy certification preferred. Required in California, Nevada, and Washington.

Work Experience
1.One year phlebotomy experience preferred.
2.Customer service in a retail or service environment preferred.
3.Keyboard/data entry experience.

All requirements are subject to possible modifications to reasonably accommodate individuals with disabilities. Quest Diagnostics is an Equal Opportunity Employer: Women / Minorities / Veterans / Disabled / Sexual Orientation / Gender Identity / Citizenship.

Opportunities for career advancement
Training provided!

Lab Assistant/Phlebotomist
JOB SUMMARY
The Lab Assistant Phlebotomist receives and processes all incoming specimens to prepare them for technical assay, ensures the specimens are handled safely to reduce cross contamination, pour-off errors, mislabeling, and missed tests. The Lab Assistant Phlebotomist is responsible for insuring that specimens are stored under proper conditions for optimal results and delivers prepared specimens to appropriate areas in a timely manner.
ESSENTIAL DUTIES AND RESPONSIBILITIES
Demonstrates phlebotomist duties as safe, skillful, courteous competency in procedures for blood sample collection, selecting the best equipment and site for the tests requested and serves as an expert venipuncture resource for difficult sticks.

Job Title: Phlebotomist - In Office Phlebotomy Virtual Hiring Event
Job Description:
$1k SIGN ON BONUS
As our In Office Phlebotomist, you will work at a doctor’s office (family practices, OB’s, Endocrinology offices, HIV clinics, Oncology practices, Gastroenterology, etc.) and will be responsible not only for quality specimen collection and processing, but also for patient focused care and client customer service.
To learn more about our In Office Phlebotomy career settings, check out our video: https://youtu.be/ixLBWag-d10


CORE FUNCTIONS
1. To include the following: 1) specimen collection 2) Manage client relationship within Compliance regulations to ensure that their needs are met and Sonora Quest’s business objectives are satisfied 3) general laboratory specimen processing or 4) referral laboratory processing. In doing so, ensuring correct patient and specimen identification and specimen integrity by using appropriate techniques for all age criteria as required. Only staff with a high school diploma or GED may perform any specified analytical testing, i.e. Point of Care testing.
2. Enters and verifies patient demographics, location, physician data, tests requested, time and date of collection, appropriate clinical information, and all other pertinent data found on requisitions as required for processing and billing. Verifies accuracy of entered information. Verifies appropriateness of specimens received. Aliquots and labels specimens according to established departmental procedures and practices, delivers specimens to the technical area in a timely manner and / or performs initial processing and preparation of samples for transport. Level II will assist lead in monitoring workflow and training of new employees
3. Focuses on quality by assuring that all work performed is accurate and complete. Completes documents legibly and accurately per site protocol. Follows established methods and practices. Maintains familiarity with departmental procedures. Uses appropriate documentation to record communications. Communicate courteously and professionally and responds accordingly. Initiates computer generated reports as required for patient reporting and quality assurance monitoring. Meets departmental standards for productivity and quality as currently defined. Level II will have knowledge of more computer functions, i.e. A.R.E. Actively participates in input to dept/system via committees or Six Sigma teams. Maintains acceptable specimen rejection rates and meets the departmental standards for productivity and quality as currently defined.
4. Participates in departmental financial responsibilities through the appropriate use of supplies and materials. Avoids excessive waste. Participates in department initiatives to reduce costs and improve service. Basic knowledge of billing. Commitment to error free work environment.
5. Communicates courteously and professionally with internal and external customers. Interacts with co-workers with an emphasis on teamwork and a focus on customer service. All employees must be able to work all areas/departments/shifts as assigned. Resolves basic service issues. Attends meetings and remains current with internal/external communications, i.e. e-mail, newsletters, etc. Increased knowledge of laboratory terminology.
6. Acknowledges and understands the importance of ‘Patient Rights’ and privacy (HIPAA). Promotes, supports and exhibits behavior consistent with the Mission, Vision, and Values of Laboratory Sciences of Arizona and customer-focused care.
